refnamediv.refpurpose: Starts, stops and retrieves the state of a user-defined HTTP listener

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This function is used to start, stop or lookup the state of user-defined HTTP and HTTPS listeners. The return value is 0 or 1 and indicates state of the listener, 1 for started and 0 for stopped.

refsect2.title: interface_address
refsect2.para: IP address of interface to be started, stopped or queried for its current state.

refsect2.title: action
refsect2.para: Can only take one of the following integer values:

refsect2.title: options
refsect2.para: An array of name-value pairs for setting up a HTTPS listeners. This parameter only used for starting HTTPS listeners, and nothing more. The available options are:

simplelist.member: https_cv - certificate authority file for verification.
https_cv_depth - depth of chain for CA verification.

refsect2.para: The certificate and key are mandatory for HTTPS listeners, but the others are optional. They are similar to the SSLCertificate, SSLPrivateKey, X509ClientVerifyCAFile, X509ClientVerifyDepth Virtuoso INI file settings.

refsect1.title: Return Types
refsect1.para: The return type is integer, and will be either 0 or 1 to indicate the state of the listener, 1 for started and 0 for stopped.
